key_points: Tiger Woods spent time with former NBA player Dwyane Wade before a serious car accident.
Woods and Wade were at a golf course, and Wade shared their outing on Instagram.
Woods was involved in a single-vehicle accident in Los Angeles County, resulting in hospitalization.
The accident occurred shortly after 7 a.m. local time on Tuesday.
Woods sustained multiple leg injuries from the crash and was undergoing surgery.
Actor David Spade was also with Woods on Monday for a golf project.
The crash caused "major damage" to the vehicle, per the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department.
Woods' agent, Mark Steinberg, confirmed the accident and Woods' condition.
The PGA Tour released a statement acknowledging the accident and offering support to Woods.
Woods was in California for the Genesis Invitational, serving as host while recovering from back surgery.
spokespersons: Spokesperson for the Los Angeles Fire Department
